title: Monsoon Alert – Torrential rains and lightning forecast in 6 states, know update - Times Bull
article_text:
Weather Forecast – A steady drop in temperatures is raising the prospect of a severe cold snap in North India. Snowfall and cold winds in the valleys of Himachal, Kashmir, and Uttarakhand are increasing the cold, worsening the situation. The cold is rapidly increasing in the northeastern states.

In addition, heavy rains in most parts of South India have led to a drop in temperatures, and the weather has become pleasant. Dense fog has enveloped Delhi-NCR, with villages and towns shrouded in fog in the early morning. Winter has begun to grip western Uttar Pradesh, with the sun’s brightness significantly diminishing. The Meteorological Department has predicted heavy rain in several states across the country. Find weather updates below.

Heavy rain warning in these states

According to the Indian Meteorological Department, heavy rain accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning is expected in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands on November 21st. A heavy rainfall alert has been issued for Tamil Nadu from November 20th to 25th, and for Kerala and Mahe from November 21st to 24th. A heavy rainfall alert has been issued for coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam, and Rayalaseema on November 21st.

A heavy rainfall alert is also expected in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands between November 20th and 23rd. In addition, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected in many areas of Tamil Nadu until November 25th. Heavy rainfall is also expected in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

Temperatures will rise here, leading to cold weather

According to the Meteorological Department, night temperatures will continue to rise in Maharashtra over the next five days. No significant change in weather is expected after that. Meanwhile, no significant change in temperatures is expected in the plains of northwest India for six to seven days.

A cold wave warning has been issued for several areas of western Madhya Pradesh on November 20th. A cold wave may occur in many places on November 21. On November 20, cold levels are also expected to increase in central Maharashtra, eastern Madhya Pradesh, and Telangana.

title: Fresh Low-Pressure Brews Over Bay Of Bengal, Heavy Rain Expected In Odisha Districts - Ommcom News
article_text:
Bhubaneswar: A fresh low-pressure system is likely to form over the Bay of Bengal on November 22, but the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) is yet to clarify whether the disturbance will develop into a cyclone.

According to the IMD, the low-pressure area is expected to intensify into a depression by November 24. The system is likely to move west-northwest, gaining strength over the next 48 hours.

Under its influence, Odisha is likely to experience heavy rainfall for four days, with the coastal and southern regions expected to receive the most significant rainfall. Rain is predicted in various parts of the state until November 25.

However, the IMD has not released any estimates regarding the system’s final intensity or potential development into a cyclonic circulation, despite some global models indicating possible intensification.

If the forecast holds true, the cyclone could bring significant rainfall to southern, coastal, and interior Odisha, posing a risk to the mature paddy crop. The region is still recovering from the impact of cyclone ‘Montha’ in October, and farmers are anxious about potential damage to their crops.

title: Weather Update: Cold Wave Tightens Grip On Delhi-NCR, Heavy Rain Ahead For Tamil Nadu, Kerala; Alerts Issued In Rajasthan - thedailyjagran.com
article_text:
By Nidhi Giri
Thu, 20 Nov 2025 07:45 AM (IST)
Source:JND
Add as a preferred
RELATED ARTICLES

Weather Update: A severe cold wave is tightening its grip across North India. Since Tuesday, temperatures have dipped sharply in Delhi-NCR, Rajasthan, Punjab, and Haryana. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has cautioned that the cold conditions are likely to intensify further in the coming days.

Fog Witnessed In THESE States

Moderate fog prevailed over Assam and Meghalaya. Scattered fog was observed over Northeast India, Bihar, eastern Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, and western Madhya Pradesh.

IMD has issued a critical cold wave warning for Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. This sudden onset of extreme cold signals an early onset of winter conditions, with night temperatures expected to drop 2 to 5 degrees Celsius below the seasonal normal.

ALSO READ: Dhanbad New Train: One-Way Special Train To Run Between Charlapalli-Darbhanga, Ticket Booking Begins

Temperature Drops Below 10 Degrees Celsius In 16 Rajasthan Districts

16 districts in Rajasthan have already recorded minimum temperatures below 10 degrees Celsius. Sikar recorded temperatures as low as 7 degrees Celsius. The IMD has issued yellow and orange alerts in vulnerable areas to ensure public awareness and preparedness against cold-related health hazards and potential agricultural impacts.

Rain Alert In South India

During the past 24 hours, light to moderate rain with isolated heavy rain occurred over Kerala and Tamil Nadu. Light to moderate rain occurred over Kerala, the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, the south coast of Andhra Pradesh, and Lakshadweep. Scattered light rain was recorded over the south coast of Karnataka.

ALSO READ: Anmol Bishnoi Sent To 11-Day NIA Custody After Deportation From US; Accused Of Aiding 'Terror Acts In India'

During the next 24 hours, light to moderate rain with isolated heavy showers are possible over the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Light to moderate rain with isolated heavy rain is possible over Kerala, Tamil Nadu, and Lakshadweep.

Fog Engulfs Parts Of Uttar Pradesh And Bihar

Fog is likely over parts of northeast India, eastern Uttar Pradesh, and Bihar. Light to moderate rain is expected over coastal Karnataka. Isolated light rain is possible over Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram.
